name: Unidentified_Gamorrean_guard_1
content:
A Gamorrean guard served under crime lords Jabba Desilijic Tiure and Bib Fortuna before the bounty hunter Boba Fett took over Jabba's Palace and established his own gotra. Sometime after the attack, the Gamorrean and a fellow guard were captured and brought before Fett. Refusing to torture the Gamorreans, Fett allowed them both to live as long as they pledged their loyalty to him.
As Fett's guard, the Gamorrean wore a metal helmet and a pauldron on each shoulder, whereas the other guard wore only a single pauldron. He carried a small sword for melee combat and a Gamorrean battle-ax. When Fett was ambushed by the Order of the Night Wind in Mos Espa, the helmeted Gamorrean sprang into action and broke through the assassins' defenses. Along with the other guard, the Gamorrean dragged Fett back to the palace's bacta pod to heal from wounds sustained in the battle.
Later, he participates with his comrade to the Battle for Mos Espa against the Pyke Syndicate and unfortunately they are killed by the Klatooinians when the three crime families betray Boba and join the Pykes. The Klatooinians pushed them of a cliff to theirs deaths.

The Gamorrean guard first appeared in "Chapter 1: Stranger in a Strange Land," the premiere episode of the television series The Book of Boba Fett, which released on Disney+ on December 29, 2021. The guard was played by Frank Trigg, who is also a former mixed martial artist, color commentator, pro wrestler, MMA referre, and TV host.
